data.title: DEFINE
questions: In this phase, define the decision and its parameters.
Identify the nature of the decision (unilateral or group)?
What decision-making rule will be used? (vote, consensus).
Will it be closed (Y/N) or open-ended (multiple choices)?
Define the parameters of the decision. What’s excluded?
Frame the decision as a question. Record and post it.
Will answering this question satisfy everyone concerned?

data.title: SHARE
questions: In this phase, share all pertinent, available information.
Gather facts from all parties. Establish accurate data.
Share all relevant, known information.
Compare, contrast and confirm any disputed information.
Identify what information is unknown, but necessary.
Make explicit any biases, inferences or assumptions.
Agree on all facts relevant to the decision.

data.title: BRAINSTORM
questions: In this phase, explore potential ways of solving the problem.
Brainstorm alternative ways of answering the question.
What are other possible ways to answer the question?
Resist any evaluation…just generate ideas/possibilities.
Specify how each possibility answers the question.
Look for synergies/hybrids among the alternatives.
Finalize a list of highest potential ideas (by multi-voting).

data.title: CONSIDER
questions: In this phase, consider peoples’ needs, interests and values in the decision.
What does each person/group need or want out of this?
What concerns/interests do we have in common?
What subjective factors figure into this decision?
What values, ethics or norms come into play?
What extenuating circumstances should be acknowledged?
How can we incorporate these considerations when deciding?

data.title: DECIDE/ANSWER
questions: Based on the previous phases, reach a decision.
Determine which principles or policies apply (if any).
Determine the criteria on which to base the decision.
Weight criteria (if necessary via decision-making rule).
Weigh pros/cons of alternatives against defined criteria.
Propose an answer given the data and decision criteria.
Use agreed-on decision-making rule to reach a decision.
Answer the question/decision as originally defined.
